2ED.Lure: all creatures able to block target creature must do so. if a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, this does not prevent this. if there is more than one attacking creature with this, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.
2ED.Library of Leng: there is no limit to size of your hand. if a card forces you to discard, you may choose to discard to top of your library rather than to graveyard. if discard is random, you may look at card before deciding where to discard it.
2ED.False Orders: you decide whether and how one defending creature blocks, though you can't make a choice the defender couldn't legally make. play after defender has chosen defense but before damage is dealt.
2ED.Mana Short: all opponent's lands are tapped, and opponent's mana pool is emptied. opponent takes no damage from unspent mana.
2ED.Clone: upon summoning, this acquires all characteristics, including color, of any one creature in play on either side; any creature enchantments on original creature are not copied. this retains these characteristics even after original creature is destroyed. this cannot be played if there are no creatures in play.
2ED.Stasis: players do not get an untap phase. pay {u} during your upkeep or this is destroyed.
2ED.Wild Growth: when tapped, target land provides 1 green mana in addition to the mana it normally provides.

2ED.Ancestral Recall: draw 3 cards or force opponent to draw 3 cards.
2ED.Howl from Beyond: target creature gains +x/+0 until end of turn.
2ED.Copy Artifact: select any artifact in play. this enchantment acts as a duplicate of that artifact; enchantment copy is affected by cards that affect either enchantments or artifacts. enchantment copy remains even if original artifact is destroyed.
2ED.Wrath of God: all creatures in play are destroyed and cannot regenerate.
2ED.Pirate Ship: tap to do 1 damage to any target. cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play, though controller may still tap. this is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.
2ED.Jade Statue: {2}: this becomes a creature for the duration of the current attack exchange. can be a creature only during an attack or defense.
2ED.Time Vault: tap to gain an additional turn after the current one. this doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must skip a turn. this begins tapped.
2ED.Animate Dead: any creature in either player's graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. if this enchantment is removed, or at end of game, target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. target creature may be killed as normal.
2ED.Blue Elemental Blast: counters a red spell being cast or destroys a red card in play.
2ED.Cursed Land: this does 1 damage to target land's controller during each upkeep.
2ED.Flight: target creature is now a flying creature.
2ED.Contract from Below: discard your current hand and draw eight new cards, adding the first drawn to your ante. remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.
2ED.Ivory Cup: {1}: any white spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.
2ED.Word of Command: you may look at opponent's hand and choose any card opponent can legally play using mana from his or her mana pool or lands. opponent must play this card immediately; you make all the decisions it calls for. this spell may not be countered after you have looked at opponent's hand.
2ED.Lich: you lose all life. if you gain life later in the game, instead draw one card from your library for each life. for each point of damage you suffer, you must destroy one of your cards in play. creatures destroyed in this way cannot be regenerated. you lose if this enchantment is destroyed or if you suffer a point of damage without sending a card to the graveyard.
2ED.Power Leak: target enchantment costs 2 extra mana each turn during upkeep. if target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana, this does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.
2ED.Mox Emerald: add 1 green mana to your mana pool. tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.
2ED.Northern Paladin: {w}{w}: and tap: destroys a black card in play. cannot be used to cancel a black spell as it is being cast.
2ED.Kudzu: when target land becomes tapped, it is destroyed. unless that was the last land in play, this is not discarded; instead, the player whose land it just destroyed may place it on another land of his or her choice.
2ED.Creature Bond: if target creature is destroyed, this does an amount of damage equal to creature's toughness to creature's controller.
2ED.Tsunami: all islands in play are destroyed.
2ED.Lifetap: you gain 1 life each time any forest of opponent's becomes tapped.
2ED.Living Lands: treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. the living lands have no color; they are not considered green cards.
2ED.Scrubland: counts as both plains and swamp and is affected by spells that affect either. tap to add either {w} or {b} to your mana pool.
2ED.Demonic Hordes: tap to destroy 1 land. pay {b}{b}{b} during upkeep or the hordes become tapped and you lose a land of opponent's choice.
2ED.Red Ward: target creature gains protection from red.
2ED.Warp Artifact: this does 1 damage to target artifact's controller at start of each turn.
2ED.Armageddon: all lands in play are destroyed.
2ED.Time Walk: take an extra turn after this one.
2ED.Underground Sea: counts as both swamp and islands and is affected by spells that affect either. tap to add either {b} or {u} to your mana pool.
2ED.Sacrifice: destroy one of your creatures without regenerating it, and add to your mana pool a number of black mana equal to creature's casting cost.

LEB.Wild Growth: when tapped, target land provides 1 green mana in addition to the mana it normally provides.
LEB.Birds of Paradise:
flying
tap to add one mana of any color to your mana pool. this tap may be played as an interrupt.
LEB.Living Artifact: put a counter on target artifact for each life you lose. during upkeep you may trade one counter for one life, but you can only trade in one counter each turn.
LEB.Ancestral Recall: draw 3 cards or force opponent to draw 3 cards.
LEB.Howl from Beyond: target creature gains +x/+0 until end of turn.
LEB.Copy Artifact: select any artifact in play. this enchantment acts as a duplicate of that artifact; enchantment copy is affected by cards that affect either enchantments or artifacts. enchantment copy remains even if original artifact is destroyed.
LEB.Wrath of God: all creatures in play are destroyed and cannot regenerate.
LEB.Pirate Ship: tap to do 1 damage to any target. cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play, though controller may still tap. this is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.
LEB.Jade Statue: {2}: this becomes a creature for the duration of the current attack exchange. can be a creature only during an attack or defense.
LEB.Time Vault: tap to gain an additional turn after the current one. this doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must skip a turn. this begins tapped.
LEB.Animate Dead: any creature in either player's graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. if this enchantment is removed, or at end of game, target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. target creature may be killed as normal.
LEB.Blue Elemental Blast: counters a red spell being cast or destroys a red card in play.
LEB.Cursed Land: this does 1 damage to target land's controller during each upkeep.
LEB.Flight: target creature is now a flying creature.
LEB.Contract from Below: discard your current hand and draw eight new cards, adding the first drawn to your ante. remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.
LEB.Ivory Cup: {1}: any white spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.
LEB.Word of Command: you may look at opponent's hand and choose any card opponent can legally play using mana from his or her mana pool or lands. opponent must play this card immediately; you make all the decisions it calls for. this spell may not be countered after you have looked at opponent's hand.
LEB.Lich: you lose all life. if you gain life later in the game, instead draw one card from your library for each life. for each point of damage you suffer, you must destroy one of your cards in play. creatures destroyed in this way cannot be regenerated. you lose if this enchantment is destroyed or if you suffer a point of damage without sending a card to the graveyard.
LEB.Power Leak: target enchantment costs 2 extra mana during upkeep. if target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana, this does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.
LEB.Mox Emerald: add 1 green mana to your mana pool. tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.
LEB.Northern Paladin: {w}{w}: and tap: destroys a black card in play. cannot be used to cancel a black spell as it is being cast.
LEB.Kudzu: when target land becomes tapped, it is destroyed. unless that was the last land in play, this is not discarded; instead, the player whose land it just destroyed may place it on another land of his or her choice.
LEB.Creature Bond: if target creature is destroyed, this does an amount of damage equal to creature's toughness to creature's controller.
LEB.Tsunami: all islands in play are destroyed.
LEB.Lifetap: you gain 1 life each time any forest of opponent's becomes tapped.
LEB.Living Lands: treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. the living lands have no color; they are not considered green cards.
LEB.Scrubland: counts as both plains and swamp and is affected by spells that affect either. tap to add either {w} or {b} to your mana pool.
LEB.Demonic Hordes: tap to destroy 1 land. pay {b}{b}{b} during upkeep or the hordes become tapped and you lose a land of opponent's choice.
LEB.Red Ward: target creature gains protection from red.
LEB.Warp Artifact: this does 1 damage to target artifact's controller at start of each turn.
LEB.Armageddon: all lands in play are destroyed.
LEB.Time Walk: take an extra turn after this one.
LEB.Underground Sea: counts as both swamp and islands and is affected by spells that affect either. tap to add either {b} or {u} to your mana pool.
LEB.Sacrifice: destroy one of your creatures without regenerating it, and add to your mana pool a number of black mana equal to creature's casting cost.

ARN.Singing Tree: tap to reduce an attacking creature's power to 0.
ARN.Ebony Horse: {2}: remove one of your attacking creatures from combat. treat this as if the creature never attacked, except that defenders assigned to block it cannot choose to block another creature.
ARN.Library of Alexandria: tap to add 1 colorless mana to your mana pool or draw a card from your library; you may use the card-drawing ability only if you have exactly seven cards in your hand.
ARN.Desert Nomads:
desertwalk
this are immune to damage done by deserts.
ARN.Mijae Djinn: if you choose to attack with this, flip a coin immediately after attack is announced; opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. if the flip ends up in opponent's favor, this is tapped but does not attack.
ARN.Cyclone: put one chip on this each round during your upkeep, then pay {g} for each chip or discard this. if not discarded, this immediately does 1 damage per chip to each player and each creature in play.
ARN.Jandor's Ring: {2}: discard a card you just drew from your library, and draw another card to replace it.
ARN.Kird Ape: this gains +1/+2 if you have any forests in play.
ARN.Erhnam Djinn: during your upkeep, you must choose one of opponent's non-wall creatures in play. until your next upkeep, that creature gains the forestwalk ability. if opponent has no creatures, ignore this effect.
ARN.Aladdin: {1}{r}{r}: and tap to take control of an artifact from opponent. artifact is returned when this is removed from play or when game ends.
ARN.Guardian Beast: as long as this is untapped, your non-creature artifacts cannot be further enchanted, destroyed, or taken under someone else's control. if something occurs that would destroy the this and artifacts simultaneously, the this is destroyed but your artifacts are not. if an artifact is enchanted or stolen while this is tapped, it remains so when this becomes untapped.
ARN.Sorceress Queen: tap to make another creature 0/2 until end of turn. treat this exactly as if the numbers in the lower right of the target card were 0/2. all special characteristics and enchantments on the creature are unaffected.
ARN.Sandals of Abdallah: {2}: gives one creature islandwalk ability until end of turn. if that creature is destroyed before end of turn, so are sandals.
ARN.Brass Man: this does not untap as normal; you must pay {1} during your untap phase to untap it.

ARN.Oasis: tap to prevent 1 damage to any creature.
ARN.Bottle of Suleiman: {1}: flip a coin, with opponent calling heads or tails while coin is in the air. if the flip ends up in opponent's favor, this does 5 damage to you. otherwise, a 5/5 flying djinn immediately comes into play on your side. use a counter to represent djinn. djinn is treated exactly like a normal artifact creature except that if it leaves play it is removed from the game entirely. no matter how the flip turns out, this is discarded after use.
ARN.Magnetic Mountain: blue creatures do not untap as normal. during their untap phases, players must spend {4} for each blue creature they wish to untap. this cost must be paid in addition to any other untap cost a given blue creature may already require.
ARN.Sindbad: tap to draw a card from your library, but discard that card if it is not a land.
ARN.Diamond Valley: tap to sacrifice one of your creatures in exchange for a number of life points equal to its toughness. note that this ability may be used after blocking has been declared.
ARN.Island Fish Jasconius: you must pay {u}{u}{u} during your untap phase to untap island fish. island fish cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play. island fish is destroyed immediately if at any time you have no islands in play.
ARN.Shahrazad: players must leave game in progress as it is and use the cards left in their libraries as decks with which to play a subgame of magic. when subgame is over, players shuffle these cards, return them to libraries, and resume game in progress, with any loser of subgame halving his or her remaining life points, rounding down. effects that prevent damage may not be used to counter this loss of life. the subgame has no ante; using less than forty cards may be necessary.
ARN.Island of Wak-Wak: tap to reduce target flying creature's power to 0.
ARN.Desert: tap to add 1 colorless mana to your mana pool or do 1 damage to an attacking creature after it deals its damage.
ARN.Drop of Honey: during your upkeep, the creature in play with the lowest power is destroyed and cannot be regenerated. if there is a tie you choose which to destroy. this must be discarded if there are no creatures in play.
ARN.Eye for an Eye: can be cast only when a creature or spell does damage to you. this does an equal amount of damage to the controller of that creature or spell. if some spell or effect reduces the amount of damage you receive, it does not reduce the damage dealt by this.

ARN.Hurr Jackal: tap to prevent a target creature from regenerating for the remainder of the turn.
ARN.Jeweled Bird: draw a card, and exchange this for your contribution to the ante. your former contribution goes to your graveyard. remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.
ARN.Ydwen Efreet: if you choose to block with this, flip a coin immediately after defense is announced; opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. if the flip ends up in opponent's favor, this cannot block this turn.
ARN.King Suleiman: tap to destroy an efreet or djinn.
ARN.City of Brass: tap to add 1 mana of any color to your mana pool. you suffer 1 damage whenever this becomes tapped.
ARN.Serendib Efreet:
flying
this does 1 damage to you during your upkeep.
ARN.Pyramids: {2}: prevents a land from being destroyed, or removes an enchantment from any land.
ARN.Cuombajj Witches: tap to do 1 damage to any target; opponent may also do 1 damage to any target. you choose your target before opponent does, but damage is inflicted simultaneously.
ARN.Camel:
bands
all creatures attacking in a band with this are immune to damage done by deserts.
ARN.Abu Ja'far: if abu dies without regenerating while participating in an attack or defense,all creatures abu is blocking or being blocked by are also killed and may not regenerate.
ARN.Flying Carpet: {2}: gives one creature flying ability until end of turn. if that creature is destroyed before end of turn, so is this.
ARN.Bazaar of Baghdad: tap to take two cards from your library, after which you must immediately discard three from your hand to your graveyard. if you don't have three or more cards in your hand, discard your whole hand. no spells may be cast between drawing and discarding cards.
ARN.Unstable Mutation: target creature gains +3/+3. each round, put a -1/-1 counter on the creature during its controller's upkeep. these counters remain even if this enchantment is removed before the creature dies.
ARN.Jihad: choose a color. as long as opponent has cards of this color in play, all white creatures gain +2/+1. this must be discarded immediately if at any time opponent has no cards of this color in play.
ARN.Metamorphosis: sacrifice a creature of yours in play for an amount of mana equal to its casting cost plus 1. this mana can be of any one color, and can only be used to summon creatures.
ARN.Ali from Cairo: while ali is in play, damage that would reduce you to less than 1 life lowers you to 1 life. all further damage is prevented.
ARN.Aladdin's Lamp: {x}: instead of drawing a card from the top of your library, draw x cards but choose only one to put in your hand. you must shuffle the leftover cards and put them at the bottom of your library.
ARN.Merchant Ship: if this attacks and is not blocked, you gain 2 life. this cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play. this is destroyed immediately if at any time you have no islands in play.
